of falafel in one pita bread is represented by  $\frac{1}{6}$ of the total, since six pita breads equal two rolls. The amount of falafel in one roll is represented by  $\frac{1}{2}$ of the total, since three rolls equal five baguettes. It follows that the amount of falafel in one baguette is equal to  $\frac{1}{10}$ of the total, or  $\frac{1}{10} x$ . You want to know how many pita breads there are equivalent to one baguette, and since one pita bread has  $\frac{1}{6}$ of the total, the number of pita breads equivalent to one baguette can be found by solving: $\frac{\frac{1}{10} x}{\frac{1}{6}}=\frac{6}{10} x=\frac{3}{5} x$ Since there are 3 pita breads equivalent to 5 baguettes, the number of pita breads equivalent to one baguette is  $\frac{3}{5}$ pita breads. Thus, the number of pita breads equivalent to 2 baguettes is $\frac{2}{5}=\frac{2}{5} \times \frac{3}{3}=\frac{6}{15}=\frac{2}{5}$ pita breads, which matches (D).
The best answer is D.

of pita breads is six times the number of the amount of falafel in one roll, so the number of falafel in three rolls would be equal to six times the amount in one roll. It follows that the amount of falafel in five baguettes is equal to six times the amount in three rolls. Six times the amount of falafel in one roll is 6 times six times the amount of falafel in one baguette; and 6 × 6 × six = 36. Therefore, there are 36 pieces of falafel in five baguettes. Therefore, if 2 baguettes contain 36 pieces of falafel, then one baguette must contain 36 ÷ 2, or 18 pieces of falafel. Finally, since six pita breads contain the same amount of falafel as two rolls, one pita bread contains half that amount of falafel; that is, one pita bread contains 9 pieces of falafel. Since one baguette contains 18 pieces of falafel and one pita bread contains 9 pieces of falafel, two baguettes contain 36 pieces of falafel, and therefore, two baguettes contain 2 times the number of pita breads, so 2 times 6 pita breads = twelve pita breads.
